channel.title: If you have read Lord of The flies
channel.description:
here are some questions :)
Hey , this is homework help isn't it :)?
1.
What is the significance of the colors used by Jack? 2.
Why is it interesting that he looks for green and cannot find it? 3.
Can you think of any symbolism with the design he chooses? 4.
Why does the war paint mask change Jack so much? 5.
Why do you think Golding chose to make the beast a soldier from the outside world? 6.
How does the discovery of the parachutist relate back to Simon's interpretation of the beast (from Chapter 5)?
7
How does Lord of the Flies concern human nature? Are there any examples from the book that you have seen? (1 paragraph) 8
What do you think? Are human beings basically good, basically bad, or something in-between? Cite whatever sources you like: books you have read, your own experience, or Scripture. Be sure to make your answer at least two paragraphs long.

item.title: If you have read Lord of The flies
item.dc:creator: @KyleGut3 KyleGut3
item.description:
@KyleGut3 wrote:

I've read it buts its been about a year now

  1. The war paint mask changes Jack so much simply because it released his inner, savage being. Before this mask, he had on a mask of civilization, one that aided in his survival in society. This new mask unlocks a deeper, more innate part of Jack's being, allowing him to become more barbaric than he ever thought possible, and in that sense, more adept at surviving in the wild.

Read full topic
